ygData.subject: Re: minotaur horn change?
ygData.msgSnippet: Well, you would think that since they can flag when you are wanting to destroy something and make it have a pop up window confirming it or you can set it to a
ygData.messageBody:
Well, you would think that since they can flag when you are wanting
to destroy something and make it have a pop up window confirming it
or you can set it to a default of "YES" then why couldn't they set it
to a default of "NO". And similarly, why couldn't they set a flag
for when you want to drop something? I think that it is totally
possible...

~Beatdrop

--- In eqbards@egroups.com, "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@d...> wrote:
> I'm not sure how they could code that without tagging them as No
Drop. I
> think that's the whole reason they haven't done it, it would
require a lot
> of changes to make items undroppable without tagging them as No
Drop in some
> fashion.
>
> -----Original Message-----
> From: beatdropbattledrum@h...
> [mailto:beatdropbattledrum@h...]
> Sent: Friday, June 02, 2000 1:46 PM
> To: eqbards@egroups.com
> Subject: [eqbards] Re: minotaur horn change?
>
>
> I think what Rokenn means is that it wouldn't TAG your items as NO
> DROP but that you just simply will not be able to drop them.
Doesn't
> that make sense?
>
> ~Beatdrop
>
> --- In eqbards@egroups.com, "Kimes, Dean W." <dean_kimes@d...>
wrote:
> > No Drop items cannot be looted from another player in PvP unless
> they
> > changed that recently. If I could tag all my items as No Drop it
> would have
> > a dramatic effect on looting in PvP.
> >
> > Kit
> >
> > Please use some common sense, this would have no effect on
looting.
> >
> > Rokenn
>
>
>
